pullRequest.title: Add redocly integration for admin api v1
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose
This PR,

Adds x-code-samples for admin rest API resources.
Adds the postman collection for admin rest API

Goals

Describe the solutions that this feature/fix will introduce to resolve the problems described above

Approach

Describe how you are implementing the solutions. Include an animated GIF or screenshot if the change affects the UI (email documentation@wso2.com to review all UI text). Include a link to a Markdown file or Google doc if the feature write-up is too long to paste here.

User stories

Summary of user stories addressed by this change>

Release note

Brief description of the new feature or bug fix as it will appear in the release notes

Documentation

Link(s) to product documentation that addresses the changes of this PR. If no doc impact, enter “N/A” plus brief explanation of why there’s no doc impact

Training

Link to the PR for changes to the training content in https://github.com/wso2/WSO2-Training, if applicable

Certification

Type “Sent” when you have provided new/updated certification questions, plus four answers for each question (correct answer highlighted in bold), based on this change. Certification questions/answers should be sent to certification@wso2.com and NOT pasted in this PR. If there is no impact on certification exams, type “N/A” and explain why.

Marketing

Link to drafts of marketing content that will describe and promote this feature, including product page changes, technical articles, blog posts, videos, etc., if applicable

Automation tests

Unit tests

Code coverage information


Integration tests

Details about the test cases and coverage



Security checks

Followed secure coding standards in http://wso2.com/technical-reports/wso2-secure-engineering-guidelines? yes/no
Ran FindSecurityBugs plugin and verified report? yes/no
Confirmed that this PR doesn't commit any keys, passwords, tokens, usernames, or other secrets? yes/no

Samples

Provide high-level details about the samples related to this feature

Related PRs

List any other related PRs

Migrations (if applicable)

Describe migration steps and platforms on which migration has been tested

Test environment

List all JDK versions, operating systems, databases, and browser/versions on which this feature/fix was tested

Learning

Describe the research phase and any blog posts, patterns, libraries, or add-ons you used to solve the problem.

commit.message: Fix admin rest API v1 link
Add sample curl commands for admin rest API v1 resources
Add postman collection for admin REST API v1
Fix admin v1 postman collection url

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                title: Subscription Throttling Policy Tetst
          
          
            
                title: Subscription Throttling Policy
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -4471,7 +4780,7 @@ definitions:
   # The Subscription Throttling Policy resource
   #-----------------------------------------------------
   SubscriptionThrottlePolicy:
-    title: Subscription Throttling Policy
+    title: Subscription Throttling Policy Tetst

commit.message: Add schemas and examples for error responses

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -100,7 +100,18 @@ info:
     ```
     Now you have a valid access token, which you can use to invoke an API. 
     Navigate through the API descriptions to find the required API, obtain an access token as described above and invoke the API with the authentication header. 
-    If you use a different authentication mechanism, this process may change.    
+    If you use a different authentication mechanism, this process may change.
+
+    # Try out in Postman
+
+    If you want to try-out the embedded postman collection with "Run in Postman" option, please follow the guidelines listed below.
+    * All of the collection resources are configured to work with both Oauth2 Bearer and basic authentication schemes, with basic authentication scheme enabled by default.

commit.message: Fix guidelines for postman collection try out

nodes.bodyText: An example is already defined for ApplicationThrottlePolicy schema definition. Why do we have to repeat an example here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -262,6 +279,20 @@ paths:
             Location header contains URL of newly created entity.
           schema:
             $ref: '#/definitions/ApplicationThrottlePolicy'
+          examples:
+            application/json:

nodes.bodyText: Shall we remove x-wso2-curl,  x-wso2-request, x-wso2-response extensions, since they are not in use?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2606,9 +2891,13 @@ paths:
       x-wso2-curl: "curl -k -X POST -H "Authorization: Bearer 0d63e133-7ad6-3aeb-9ca9-9299e0708122" -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://apis.wso2.com/api/am/admin/v1/labels -d @data.json"
       x-wso2-request: "POST https://localhost:9443/api/am/admin/v1/labels
Authorization: Bearer 0d63e133-7ad6-3aeb-9ca9-9299e0708122
Content-Type: application/json

   {
       "name":"internal",
	"description":"label used for internal purpose",
	"accessUrls":[
	  "https://localhost:9095"
         ]
     }"

nodes.bodyText: Why do we have to repeat the example here? Can't we move this to label definition itself?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2617,6 +2906,19 @@ paths:
           required: true
           schema:
             $ref: '#/definitions/Label'
+          examples:
+            test:
+              summary: summary1

@@ -4308,6 +4702,111 @@ parameters:
     type: string
     required: true
 
+responses:
+
+  # Bad Request Response Schema
+  BadRequest:
